page.title: 07HACKLINGE AREA HOUSING
page.content: The area as a whole is sparsely popu- lated. There are seven places where the houses are concentrated into groups. Mill Lane and Jubilee Road in Worth, Ham, Hacklinge, Finglesham, Burgess Green and Betteshanger Colliery. The more scattered houses were often old farm houses and the cottages connected with them.There are Council houses, flats and old people's bungalows in Jubilee Road and houses at Burgess Green. The 100 houses at the Colliery belong to the N.C.B. There is little other tenanted property. Two houses are empty and one is derelict. All but one house are connected to main electricity. There is no mains gas and about 25% of the houses are connected to main drainage. Some Council houses are owner-occupied.
